Hiking Organizer

University of Witwatersrand | Software Development 3


Background

Groups of four were created and the aim of the project was to utilise Agile methodologies to create a Web Application which allows hikers to connect. An MVC architecture was used in conjunction with Pug as a template engine and passport.js for security. The App was deployed on the Microsoft Azure platform, utilising Travis CI for Continuous Integration.


Features

  • A user can create an account and log into the app.
  • A user can be a member of at most 5 hiking groups at once.
  • A user is able to create a new hiking group and/or apply to join existing ones.
  • A group member can post messages to the hiking group and interact with other group members.
  • A group member can organise a hiking session by posting location and time to the group. An invite for a hiking session can only be accepted by the members who comply with Covid-19 screening regulations.
  • A new membership application to an existing hiking group is accepted only if the majority of the members of the group vote in favour of the applicant.


My Contributions

User Registration

Allowed Users to Register with a Username and Password

  • Utilised Sequelize as an Object-Relational Mapper to store Users a database
  • The passwords were encrypted using the crypto library and the SHA512 hashing algorithm

Groups

Users can Create and Join Hiking Groups

  • Implemented a Many-to-Many relationship between Users and Groups to allow Users to Create and Join Groups
  • Users can send other Users an Invite to a Group. Group Invites are displayed on the Users Dashboard

Voting System

Users can only be accepted into a Group if majority of the Group Members Accept the Request

  • Implemented a Voting system which notifies all group members when a New Member requests to join the Group
  • The User will be added to the group once majority of Users Accept the Request
